author: Staff Reporter
text:
Over 200 doctors and medical officers attached to the Government General Hospital and Primary Health Centres under the banner of Indian Medical Association and Puducherry Government Medical Officers Association on Friday staged a demonstration.

Assault on doctor

It was held in front of the GH to mark their protest against the assault of a doctor at the Karikalampakkam PHC on Thursday.

A spokesperson of the Puducherry Medical Officers Association said that a patient who was brought to the PHC on Thursday morning was declared brought dead by the duty doctor.

However, the patient’s attendees thrashed the doctor and verbally abused the staff at the PHC.

The group also allegedly tried to pour diesel on the ambulance parked in front of the PHC and set in on fire.

'Attacks will demoralise medical fraternity'

“Such attacks would demoralise the medical fraternity and would lead to fear and reluctance on the part of doctors to treat sick patients. We can no longer tolerate attacks and demand the police to take immediate action against the culprits. The government should pass an ordinance to deal with deterrence against those indulging in attacks”, a doctor said.

They were protesting against assault of a doctor at Karikalampakkam health centre
title: Over 200 doctors stage protest
